required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Durability of Virologic Response and/or Viral Resistance Patterns in Participants With Chronic Hepatitis C Who Have Been Previously Treated With MK-5172 (MK-5172-017)
clinical_study.official_title: A Long-Term Follow-Up Study to Evaluate the Durability of Virologic Response and/or Viral Resistance Patterns of Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis C Who Have Been Previously Treated With MK-5172 in a Prior Clinical Trial

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This three-year multicenter study is being done to follow participants who received at least one dose of MK-5172 in a previous study to determine if they remain hepatitis C virus (HCV)-RNA negative over time, and to determine if they have developed antiviral resistance. The study will also evaluate long-term adverse events in this population.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.time_frame: From Last Dose of MK-5172 Up to ~ 36 Months After Enrollment in This Study

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Antiviral Resistance
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Last Dose of MK-5172 Up to ~ 36 Months After Enrollment in This Study

arm_group.description: Participants previously received MK-5172 as study treatment.

intervention.description: MK-5172 was not administered to participants in the course of this study.
intervention.other_name: Participants previously received study treatment with MK-5172 at the dose and frequency specified in the study protocol.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples will be collected and retained for purposes of DNA testing and plasma will be retained for future biomedical research.

study_pop.textblock: Participants who received at least one dose of MK-5172 while enrolled in a study and that achieved undetectable HCV-RNA status and did not start any new HCV-RNA therapy between the end of the previous study and enrollment in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previously participated in an MK-5172 protocol and received at least one dose of MK-5172
- Must enroll in the present study within one year of the treatment portion of the previous MK-5172 protocol except in the circumstance where the previous protocol has a follow-up period â‰¥1 year
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
